Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for routing protocols, network topology, and integration with existing on-premises and Azure networks.
Design the network architecture, including placement of Azure Route Server, integration with virtual networks, and configuration of Border Gateway Protocol (BGP).
Deploy Azure Route Server in the Azure portal or using Azure CLI/PowerShell. Ensure it is provisioned in the correct region and virtual network.
Set up BGP peering between Azure Route Server and your network devices. Define ASN, IP addresses, and routing policies.
Apply security best practices such as Network Security Groups (NSGs), route filters, and access control policies to secure the Azure Route Server setup.
Perform thorough testing of routing configurations, including failover scenarios, route advertisements, and route acceptance policies.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor and Network Watcher. Configure alerts for BGP session status, route changes, and performance metrics.
Document the Azure Route Server setup, including network architecture, BGP configurations, and operational procedures. Share documentation with the operations team.
Ensure the setup meets all regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to verify compliance and security postures.
Conduct training sessions for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting Azure Route Server. Provide ongoing support as needed.
Use Azure Monitor and Network Watcher to continuously monitor the health and operational status of the Azure Route Server. Investigate any anomalies or potential issues.
Regularly check the stability of BGP sessions between Azure Route Server and connected routers. Monitor for route flaps or unexpected changes in route advertisements.
Analyze route advertisements to ensure they align with expected configurations and do not include unauthorized or incorrect routes.
Conduct failover tests to verify that redundant paths and configurations function correctly in case of primary path failures.
Review and update security policies, including access controls and encryption settings, to ensure the Azure Route Server is secure against potential threats.
Conduct audits of the Azure Route Server configuration to ensure compliance with documented architecture and best practices.
Regularly back up the configuration of Azure Route Server and connected routers. Ensure secure storage of backups for potential restoration.
Keep Azure Route Server documentation up-to-date, including operational procedures, configuration details, and troubleshooting guides.
Conduct incident response drills to prepare the team for potential security incidents or Azure Route Server outages. Ensure familiarity with procedures and protocols.
Evaluate the SLA performance of the connectivity provider for Azure Route Server. Address any issues or deviations from the agreed SLA metrics.
Develop and execute plans for Azure Route Server upgrades or expansions as needed. Ensure minimal disruption during these activities.
Collect and analyze user feedback regarding Azure Route Server performance and reliability. Implement continuous improvements based on this feedback.
